descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...four colored lines that form either a square or rectangular shape in the middle of the black background with colored squares in it.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the size of the square or rectangle shape in the middle of the black background that is formed by the four colored lines.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the grid size to just the square or rectangle formed by the four colored lines. Then look at the random dots in the middle of the square or rectangle. Find the colored border that matches the color of the dots, using that color, you will connect each dot to that border in a straight line. You should have 3 to four straight lines touching the matching border.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...four colored lines that form a square or rectangular shape.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the size of this square created by the four lines.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to....copy the inner square or rectangular shape to the input then fill in the middle from the color line that match the pixels already there, to the colored pixel.  This can be up, down, left, or right, start from the colored edge and fill in to the pixel with the same color.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a design that is split by two vertical lines and two horizontal lines.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...will change to the middle section that is bounded by the vertical and horizontal lines; you want to include these bounding lines in your output.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...recreate the middle section; you need to include the horizontal and vertical boundary lines in the original image around this middle section. Keep the boundary colors the exact same. Next, add the colored squares as they are on the inside of the box. We will add some connecting lines to these squares inside of the box. All of the colored lines you add will be the same color as the squares inside.If this middle box is more long than tall, you will add a line from the right on each row that you have a colored square on. It will fill in from right to left until you reach the colored square. If the middle box is more tall than long, the lines will go from bottom to top in each column that you have a colored square, until you reach the colored square. If the middle box is equally tall and long, the vertical lines you add for each column will go from top to bottom instead.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...four colored lines that form either a square or rectangular shape in the middle of the black background with colored squares in it.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the size of the square or rectangle shape in the middle of the black background that is form by the four colored lines.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the middle square or rectangle from the large black background complete with the colored lines that form the borders of the shape, and then copy the colored squares in it. Then find the border that match the color of the squares and draw vertical or horizontal lines from the colored square in the middle to the colored border with same color.
